All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
City
This class contains the variables and methods needed to define and retrieve a city.
CityController
This class contains all the methods used to "communicate" with Postman.
CityFilters
This class contains the methods needed to filter the data according to the city chosen by the user.
CityService
This interface is used to contain all the methods called up by the user, via Postman and/or through the terminal, that interact with the cities saved in the program.
CityServiceImpl
This class implements the methods defined in the associated "CityService" interface.
CityStats
This class is used to define all the attributes that characterize the statistics concerning the temperature of a city.
CompareStats
This interface contains all the methods that are implemented in the "CompareStatsImpl" class.
CompareStatsImpl
This class contains the methods that deal with comparing statistical data of different cities and/or periods of time.
CreatingJSONDocument
This class contains the method used to create (or update) the Json file, which is used to save the required statistics.
DateTimeFilters
This interface contains all the methods that are implemented in the "DateTimeFiltersImpl" class.
DateTimeFiltersImpl
This class contains the methods necessary to filter the data according to a time range chosen by the user, and print them on the terminal.
JSONFileManager
This class contains the method to deserialize information saved on a Json file, and copy it into a JSONStructure-type ArrayList.
JSONStructure
This class extends the class "CityStats" (consequently it inherits its attributes and methods), and it is used to model the Json file "FileCities.json" information deserialized by the "JSONFileManager" class.
Menu
This class contains the menu (usable through the terminal) which the user will have to interact with to use the program.
Open_Weather_Project
This class represents the start of the assigned project, and therefore contains the "main" method.
ParseJSONDocument
This class contains the method used to parse the Json file received through the call to the OpenWeather API.
